Name: IT Cost Transparency
Description: In support of the governor’s goal for an effective, efficient and open government, processes and tools that enable the State enterprise to model and track the total cost to deliver and maintain IT services, ultimately restoring the public’s trust in government by improving cost-effectiveness, transparency and accountability.  This is a new CIO priority introduced in 2016.

Name: HJIS Portal - Appscan, Pen Test, & Remediation
Integrated Justice Information Sharing
Description: The HIJIS Program is designed to build statewide information sharing capabilities across the whole of the justice and public safety enterprise, facilitate information exchange with key federal agencies, and to leverage national information sharing standards and best practices.

Name: eSign
Description: Obtain electronic signatures to save time, paper.

Name: Enterprise Programs and Projects
Description: Purpose: Pursuant to HRS section 27-43, facilitating and ensuring the successful execution of programs and projects identified as priority and/or enterprise in scope, leveraging economies of scale and setting standard platforms for IT systems to maximizing positive ROI (e.g., tax, health and human services, asset management, budget, finance, grants, human resources, payroll, procurement, and time and attendance).

Name: Sex Offender Registration
Description: Maintenance and verification of information and records of individuals who are classified as covered offenders under Chapter 846E, HRS. Includes timely entry of covered offender information into the Registry, dissemination of covered offender information to law enforcement and the public, and tracking compliance of registered covered offenders.

Name: WiFi Access Points
Description: Provide wireless connectivity for work purposes.

Name: National Crime Information Center
Description: Provide connectivity and oversee operational responsibilities associated with access to the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) NCIC System which contains national criminal justice information provided by all 50 states, U.S. territories and other agencies and the FBI Interstate Identification Index (III) which provides national criminal history record information via NCIC

Name: Open Data
Description: Purpose: Pursuant to HRS sections 27-43 and 27-44, building on established open data and transparency platforms to facilitate open data mandates.

Name: Juvenile Justice
Description: Juvenile Justice Information System (JJIS) aggregates timely, accurate and complete histories of juvenile offenders, runaways and missing juveniles. The participating agencies are the four county police departments, the four county prosecuting attorneys, the four circuits of the Family Court, the Hawaii Youth Correctional Facility and the Department of the Attorney General.

Name: Software Maintenance, Support, and Licensing
Description: Symantec, Tennable, VNC, Condusiv

Name: Fingerprint Identification
Description: Operation and coordination of the statewide fingerprint identification system of those arrested or adjudicated and other records from law enforcement, custodial and judicial agencies in the State. Included is the maintenance of the AFIS which stores the electronic fingerprint images of adult offenders and juvenile law violators, palm prints, with enhanced latent search capabilities.

Name: KEIKI Mainframe and Services ongoing Maintenance/Support
CSEA IVR System Develop & Implementation of Project
CSEA Content Manager System - Additional Functionality/Licenses
IT Governance
Description: Purpose: Provide essential State oversight necessary so intended objectives are achieved and positive return on investment (ROI) is realized for the people of Hawai‘i.

Name: Disaster Recovery Equipment or Services for CSEA - Planning
Description: Infrastructure, and Print Capability, etc.  Includes Contingency Planning and Periodic Excercises
Project: Disaster Recovery Equipment or Services for CSEA

Name: Cybersecurity
Description: Purpose: Pursuant to HRS sections 27-43 and 27-43.5, Cybersecurity  maintains the security posture of State government IT systems through enterprise policies and standards and direct remedial actions, when necessary, to protect critical IT infrastructure and data.

Name: Services-Oriented Infrastructure
Description: Purpose: Pursuant to HRS section 27-43, managing enterprise shared services centrally to leverage economies of scale (e.g., network, data management, unified communications, data center, and various cloud services).

Name: KEIKI Front-End / Web Services and Software Support
Project: KEIKI Front-End / Web Services and Software Support

Name: Disaster Recovery Equipment or Services for CSEA - Implementation
Project: Disaster Recovery Equipment or Services for CSEA

Name: Criminal History
Description: Provide for the maintenance and operations of this automated information system which collects and disseminates individual criminal history record information for offenders arrested and fingerprinted statewide.

Name: Ongoing Hardware Maintenance Supoprt CISCO, IBM, Canon, Xerox
CSEA KEIKI System - Modernization Feasibility Study
CSEA Call Center Monthly Services and Equipment Charges
Expungement Web Application
Description: Processing of an applicant’s expungement of arrest records, pursuant to Section 831-3.2, HRS, which consists of the research of an applicant’s criminal history, the evaluation of expungeme

Name: IT Workforce Development
Description: Purpose:  Programs, strategies & reforms that empower the State’s IT workforce to increase ability to modernize government processes, systems, solutions & services while reducing over-reliance on third-party consultants where cost-effective.  Efforts involve the establishment of flexible programs to attract & retain individuals possessing modern IT disciplines to fill service & skill gaps within the State’s IT operations, building outreach campaigns to recruit candidates from non-traditional sectors, & continuing to develop internship & apprenticeship programs to expose government opportunities to high school graduates & degree program participants.

Name: Prolaw
Description: Case management, timekeeping system

Name: CSEA Content Manager System - Ongoing Support
Expungement Web Application On-line application & Status
Description: Processing of an applicant’s expungement of arrest records, pursuant to Section 831-3.2, HRS, which consists of the research of an applicant’s criminal history, the evaluation of expungeme

Name: Networking Services
Description: Provide networking and computer-related support services in responding to the needs of the department and public.

Name: iManage
Description: Document management system
